turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Itta Bena, now, uh, that would be...

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Isn't it, uh...

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: ...Nah, that ain't right... I'm thinkin' of...

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: ...I believe, unless I'm very much mistaken - see, we've been away for several years, uh...

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: It was a moment a weakness!

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Quitcha babblin' Pete - time to skedaddle.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: They lured me out for a bathe, then they dunked me'n trussed me up like a hog and turned me in for the bounty.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: I shoulda guessed it - typical womanly behavior. Just lucky we left before they came for us.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: It's awful white of ya to take it like that, Everett. I feel wretched, spoilin' yer play for a million dollars'n point two. It's been eatin' at my guts.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Aw, that's all right.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Pete, uh, I don't want ya to beat yourself up about this thing...

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: I cain't help it, but that's a wonderful thing to say!

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Well, but Pete...

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Fact of the matter - there never was!

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: But... but...

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: But...

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Damnit, I just hadda bust out! My wife wrote me she was gettin' married! I gotta stop it!

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: ...No treasure... I had two weeks left on my sentence...

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: I couldn't wait two weeks! She's gettin' married tomorra!

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: ...With my added time for the escape, I don't get out now 'til 1987... I'll be eighty-four years old.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Pete... I do apologize.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Eighty-four years old! I'll be gummin' pab-you-lum!

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Well, it's a invitation-only affair; we'll have to sneak in through the service entrance-

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Wait a minute - who elected you leader a this outfit? Since we been followin' your lead we got nothin' but trouble! I gotten this close to bein' strung up, n'consumed in a fire, 'n whipped no end, 'n sunstroked, 'n soggied -

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: This is crazy. No one's ever gonna believe we're a real band.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: No, this is gonna work! I just gotta get close enough to talk to her. Takin' off with us is got a lot more future in it than marrying a guy named Waldrip.  I'm goddamn bona fide. I've got the answers!

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: We prayed to God and he pitied us!

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: It just never fails; once again you two hayseeds are showin' how much you want for innalect. There's a perfectly scientific explanation for what just happened -

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: That ain't the tune you were singin' back there at the gallows!

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Well any human being will cast about in a moment of stress. No, the fact is, they're flooding this valley so they can hydro-electric up the whole durned state...

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Two weeks! That don't do me no good!

turns.speaker: PROPRIETOR
turns.text: Nearest Ford auto man's Bristol.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Hold on there - I don't want this pomade, I want Dapper Dan.

turns.speaker: PROPRIETOR
turns.text: I don't carry Dapper Dan. I carry Fop.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: No! I don't want Fop! Goddamnit - I use Dapper Dan!

turns.speaker: PROPRIETOR
turns.text: Watch your language, young fellow, this is a public market. Now, if you want Dapper Dan I can order it for you, have it in a couple of weeks.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Well, ain't this place a geographical oddity-two weeks from everywhere! Forget it! Just the dozen hairnets!

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Who's the honcho around here?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I am. Hur you?

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Well sir, my name is Jordan Rivers and these here are the Soggy Bottom Boys outta Cottonelia Mississippi- Songs of Salvation to Salve the Soul. We hear you pay good money to sing into a can.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Well that all depends. You boys do Negro songs?

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Sir, we are Negroes. All except our a-cump- uh, company-accompluh- uh, the fella that plays the gui-tar.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Well, I don't record Negro songs. I'm lookin' for some ol'-timey material.  Why, people just can't get enough of it since we started broadcastin' the 'Pappy O'Daniel Flour Hour', so thanks for stoppin' by, but-

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Sir, the Soggy Bottom Boys been steeped in ol'-timey material. Heck, you're silly with it, aintcha boys?

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Hot damn, boy, I almost believe you did sell your soul to the devil!

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Boys, that was some mighty fine pickin' and singin'. You just sign these papers and I'll give you ten dollars apiece.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Okay sir, but Mert and Aloysius'll have to scratch Xes - only four of us can write.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Now what can I do you for, Mister French?

turns.speaker: FRENCH
turns.text: How can I lay hold a the Soggy Bottom Boys?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Soggy Bottom Boys - I don't precisely recollect, uh -

turns.speaker: FRENCH
turns.text: They cut a record in here, few days ago, old-timey harmony thing with a guitar Accump-accump-uh-

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Oh I remember 'em, colored fellas I believe, swell bunch a boys, sung into yon can and skedaddled.

turns.speaker: FRENCH
turns.text: Well that record has just gone through the goddamn roof! They're playin' it as far away as Mobile! The whole damn state's goin' ape!

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: It was a powerful air.

turns.speaker: FRENCH
turns.text: Hot damn, we gotta find those boys! Sign 'em to a big fat contract! Hell's bells, Mr. Lunn, if we don't the goddamn competition will!

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Oh mercy, yes. You gotta beat that competition.

turns.speaker: PAPPY
turns.text: Languishing! Goddamn campaign is languishing! We need a shot inna arm!  Hear me, boys? Inna goddamn ARM!  Election held tomorra, that sonofabitch Stokes would win it in a walk!

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Well he's the reform candidate, Daddy.

turns.speaker: PAPPY
turns.text: ...Yeah?

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Well people like that reform. Maybe we should get us some.

turns.speaker: PAPPY
turns.text: I signed that bill! I signed a dozen a those aggi-culture bills! Everyone knows I'm a friend a the fahmuh! What do I gotta do, start diddlin' livestock?!

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: We cain't do that, Daddy, we might offend our constichency.

turns.speaker: PAPPY
turns.text: We ain't got a constichency! Stokes got a constichency!

turns.speaker: PAPPY
turns.text: Holy-moly. These boys're a hit!

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: But Pappy, they's inter-grated.

turns.speaker: PAPPY
turns.text: Well I guess folks don't mind they's integrated.

turns.speaker: YOUNGEST
turns.text: Daddy!

turns.speaker: MIDDLE
turns.text: He ain't our daddy!

turns.speaker: MIDDLE
turns.text: Mama said you was hit by a train!

turns.speaker: YOUNGEST
turns.text: Blooey!

turns.speaker: MIDDLE
turns.text: That's a maiden name.

turns.speaker: YOUNGEST
turns.text: You got a maiden name, Daddy?

turns.speaker: YOUNGEST
turns.text: It's bona fide!

turns.speaker: MIDDLE
turns.text: He's a suitor!

turns.speaker: MIDDLE
turns.text: She's at the five and dime.

turns.speaker: YOUNGEST
turns.text: Buyin' nipples!

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: You, Zack?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Yes, Sir.

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: I'm Byron. Nice to meet you.  C'mon. Let's go get your luggage.

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: How was the flight? They take care of you okay? Long way from Norfolk, isn't it?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: Listen, kid, I was sorry to hear about your mom. That's pretty rough. I would've returned your call a lot sooner but I was out at sea...

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: I been calling for four months.

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: Well, that's how long I've been out at sea.

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: This is it. This is where I live. I suppose you could bunk over there and you could go to school at the base.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Great.

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: I'm not finished. I'll only be in port one week a month and when I'm here you'd never catch me playing daddy with you 'cause it's not who I am. Like I told you on the phone, you I'd be better off in that state school back in Virginia.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: I ain't never going back to that school, sir.

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: You got to kid. Let me spell it out for you. This is a whorehouse. And I happen to like my life the way it is and nobody's gonna make me change.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: I don't care about that. I just ain't going back. You don't want me? Okay. I'll find me another place.

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: Come back here, kid!

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: Okay, okay. You win.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Thank you, sir!

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: Stop calling me 'sir! I ain't no officer. My name is Byron.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Hi, Byron.

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: Zack, you little shit! You haven't changed a bit!

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Neither have you, pard!

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: Hey, honey, look at this! My son! Isn't he beautiful?  You should've called!

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: You were out at sea! Hey, guess what? I graduated. I got my degree.

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: I thought you quit school. Last I heard you were on your way to a construction job or something down in Brazil.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Yeah, I made some money down there, then I talked my way into another college and I did it. I wasn't magna cum laude but I did okay. You should've seen me in my cap and gown.

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: Why the fuck didn't you invite me? I would've come.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Ay, palequero. Never hochi in the P.I.

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: Wha-chu-say, palequero? Short time, long time, only ten dolla.

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: So what're you doing in Seattle?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Get ready pard. This one's gonna blow you away.

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: Zackie, nothing you do will ever surprise me, pard, not after some of the shit you've pulled.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: I joined the Navy.

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: You... in the Navy?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: That's right. I'm on my way over to this officer school in Port Ranier.

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: To fly jets. To be the fastest motherfucker in the world. You gotta come and visit me. I'm only a couple hours away.

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: Who gave you this idea?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Nobody. It just came to me.

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: Don't be pissed. I'm on your side, Pard. I just don't want you to do something you'll regret. You gotta give six years to the Navy if you wanna fly... that's six years with the most uptight assholes God put on this earth. Officers aren't like you and me, man. It's another breed.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: You afraid you'll have to salute me, Chief?

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: Fuck, no! Why would I care about something as dumb as that?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: I don't know. That's just how it sounded. Well, I'll see you.

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: Hey, what did you want? A lot of fatherly bullshit? A big pat on the back?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: From you, pard? Never. Thanks for the graduation present.

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: Hey, Zackie -- don't go away mad.

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: Who's that?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Nobody. Just a girl I've been making it with the last couple of weekends.

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: Great ass.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Yeah, I sort of thought so myself.

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: Better watch out for that kind, Zackie. You know what they call 'em, don't ya?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Yeah, I know.

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: Back east in Newport, Rhode Island, they call 'em the Fall River Debs. In Pensacola, the Mobile Debs. In Norfolk --

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: That what she was... a Norfolk Deb?

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: Who?  Aw shit, Zackie, let's not get off on your mother again, please.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: What if I want to talk about her, pard? What then? You know, that's all I've ever heard from you, since I was a kid... you never want to talk about that, man, and it's important.

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: There's nothing to talk about. Two goddamn times I made it with your old lady. We barely even talked.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: That's not how she told it. She said you wrote her every week you were away.

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: I wrote. Not every week...

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: She said you told her in every letter how much you loved her, how you wanted to marry her, have children with her...

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: I never said any of that!

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: I found them, pard, and read them myself, right after she did it!

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: Okay, I wrote those things... and yeah, I had big thoughts of getting together with your mom... but when she hit me with being pregnant, I saw who she was. I'd had quiff lay that shit on me before!

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: What did you call her? What did I hear you call her, you son of a bitch?

turns.speaker: BYRON
turns.text: I knew you'd make it!  Where's your girl? Didn't she come?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Naw. That's over with.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: You're pretty funny, Mayo.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Maybe we'll be roommates, Seeger, and you'll find out how funny I really am...

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Hey, baby, you could get sent to war, get your ass shot down.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Don't lose any sleep over it. I wouldn't mind being the first woman to fly a jet fighter in combat.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Great. You can go in my place.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Good morning, girls.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Ever heard of knocking, mayo?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Hey, did you hear? Sands and Kantrowitz DORed last night.  Survival of the fittest.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: The whole world's a jungle, huh, Mayo? Dog eat dog down to the last one, right?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: You got it, Sweet Pea.  Nice boonies, Seeger.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Zack, we've got to go.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Just trying to have fun. That fucking prison is really starting to get to me. C'mon, Seeger. Gimme a push.  Fuck you guys! I'll do it myself!

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Go on, Zack! Go for the record!

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Fuck the record. Now you listen to me and do exactly what I tell you.  Start back ten yards and take off from here. Not here... or there... but right here!  No excuses, Seeger! You are going to plant those legs here and then you're going to yank yourself over that wall because you have to! You want jets? Then do it, goddamnit!

turns.speaker: ESTHER
turns.text: Joe!

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Come over here where I can see you.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Esther, do you think she's using...  ...birth control?

turns.speaker: ESTHER
turns.text: Yes, Joe.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: When did this happen?

turns.speaker: ESTHER
turns.text: A long time ago.

turns.speaker: ESTHER
turns.text: He doesn't mean anything by it, Zack. Do you, Joe?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I don't mean anything by it.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Are you laughing at me, dick-brain?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: No, sir!

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: What's your name, boy?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Mayo, Zack Mayo, sir!

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: How did you slip into this program, Mayo? I didn't know the Navy was so hard up.  You got an injury there, Mayo?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Not exactly, sir.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Where'd you get this, Mayo? This is really wonder work.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Subic Bay, sir. In the Philippines.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I thought I recognized the work.  Be proud of those wings. They're the only ones you're gonna leave here with, Mayo-naise.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I want your D.O.R.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: No, sir. You can kick me out, but I'm not quitting.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Get into your fatigues, Mayo. Before the weekend's out, you'll quit.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: She may not make it through the program, but she's got more heart and more character than you'll ever have. I've seen your college record. I've never heard of most of those schools. Tell me something, Mayo. Did you buy that degree?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: No, sir! It was the hardest thing I ever did, sir! Until this.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: That's a lie, Mayo. You've gone through a lot worse, haven't you?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Stop eyeballing me, mister! I've looked through your file and done a little checking, and I know it all. I know about your mother. I know your old man's an alcoholic and a whore chaser.  Life sure has dealt you some shitty cards! Hasn't it, Mayo?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: I'm doing okay, sir.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: No you're not. You're failing the big one, baby, and I don't just mean in here. I mean in life. I've watched you, Mayo, and you don't mesh. You grab-ass and joke around but you don't make friends, not the way the others do.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Hey, what do you say we call off this little charade of yours over a couple of beers at Trader Jon's...? Come on, man. You're about as close to being officer material as me.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Sir, this candidate believes he'll make a good officer, sir!

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: No way, Mayo. You don't give a shit about anybody but yourself and every single one of your classmates knows it. Think they'd trust you behind the controls of a plane they have to fly in? Hey, man, I figure you for the kind of guy who'd zip off one day in my F-14 and sell it to the Cubans.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Sir, that's not true! I love my country!

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Sell it to the Air Force, Mayo!

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: I want to fly, sir!

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: That's no reason. Everybody wants to fly. My grandmother wants to fly. You going after a job with one of the airlines?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: I want to fly jets, sir!

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Why? Because you can do it alone?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: No, sir!

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: What is it, the kicks? Is that it?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: I don't want to do something anybody can do.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Pity you don't have the character.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: That's not true, sir! I've changed a lot since I've been here! And I'm gonna make it, sir!

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Not a fucking chance, asshole!

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Mayo, are those your friends?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Yes, sir!

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Maybe there's hope for you yet.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: You didn't kick him out...? Wait, didn't he tell you what he's been going through?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: It doesn't matter what he's going through. That's the whole purpose of this zoo. What matters is he freaked out for some reason at twenty-five thousand feet and that can't ever happen again.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: But you don't understand. There's this girl he's gotten pregnant and she's putting him through hell, sir.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: I thought the D.I.'s were supposed to help you in this place! What kind of human being are you?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Stop eyeballing me, Mayo, or you're out!

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Mayo, the rest of your class knows about candidate Worley, and we're all sorry.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Sir, this officer candidate requests permission to speak to you in private.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I'm busy, Mayo. It'll have to wait.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: It's important, sir!

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Mayo, you didn't hear me -- I said I I'm busy! And so are you! Go get cleaned up!

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Aw screw it...

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: What're you waiting for, Mayo? Get your scuzzy ass up here.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Yes, sir!

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You're good.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Get on your feet and find out how good, sir.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Congratulations, Ensign Mayo, sir!

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: I'll never forget you as long as I live, Sergeant.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Well, goodbye.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: See you in the fleet, sir!

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Yeah. See you in the fleet, Sarge. And thank you.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Hi, son.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: How're you doing, Sarge?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: What did you call me?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Pardon?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: What did you call me, boy?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: I called you Sarge.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Before that.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: I didn't call you anything before that.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You said, 'How're you?' I am not a 'ewe,' boy! A ewe is a female sheep, boy! Is that what you think I am, boy?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: No, sir!

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: No, sir.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Lauder, Sweet Pea!

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: No, sir!

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Do you want to fuck me up the ass, boy? Is that why you called me a 'ewe'? Are you a queer?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: No, sir.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Where are you from, boy?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Oklahoma City, Oklahoma.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Only two things come out of Oklahoma, steers and queers. Which one are you, boy? I don't see any horns so you must be a queer.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: No, sir.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Stop whispering, Sweet Pea, you're giving me a hard on!

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Whatever you say, Mayonnaise.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Fall out on the lawn in five minutes, in your Poopie suits!

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: What did you call me, Mayo?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Zack, don't!

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Now when I say "understand" I want the whole group to say, "Yes, sir!" Understand?

turns.speaker: GROUP
turns.text: Yes, sir!

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Louder!

turns.speaker: GROUP
turns.text: Yes, sir!!

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I don't believe what I'm seeing! Where've you been all your lives, at an orgy? Listening to Mick Jagger and bad mouthing your country, I'll bet.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Stop eyeballing me, boy! You are not worthy enough to look your superiors in the eye. Use your peripheral vision! Understand?!

turns.speaker: GROUP
turns.text: Yes, sir!

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I know why most of you are here. We're not stupid. But before you get to sell what we teach you over at United Airlines, you gotta give the Navy six years of your life, Sweet Pea. Lot of things can happen in six year. Another war could come up in six years. If you're too peaceful a person to dump napalm on an enemy village where there might be women and children, I'm gonna find that out. Understand?

turns.speaker: GROUP
turns.text: Yes, sir!

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: I know I'm late and I'm sorry, but Mrs. Rufferwell asked us to help with the cleanup and...

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I said, come here!

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Daddy, I don't want to get into anything with you tonight. I'm tired and I...

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: What are you tired from?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: I don't know what it is. It could be anything.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: But you knew right off what I was talking about, didn't you, Paula! Did you let that boy --

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Don't you dare ask me that question. I'm an adult and you got no right to push your nose into my affairs like that!

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Well, as long as you live in this house, young lady, you live by my rules! You should be dating local boys.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Uh-uh! Not a chance! There's nobody in this town doing anything with his life, except what his father did, which is nothing. If I can't have more out of life than that, I'd rather be dead!

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Do you honestly think you'll find a boy in that... that officer's school who's serious about marriage?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Yes I do!

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Then you're dumber than I thought! All you'll get from their kind is pregnant!

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: Is this you boys first night of liberty since you got here?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Yes, ma'am. Four long, hard weeks of sacrifice for my country... for my people... for you. But I survived.

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: You been through the Dilbert Dunker yet?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Cake walk. Both my dad and my brother went through it and made it, so I know I can.

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: Is your brother a flyer?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: He was. He died.

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: Vietnam?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: I had a big brother who died over there, too. He wasn't no flyer though. He was just your basic Marine Corps type. I was only twelve when it happened, so I don't remember much about him.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: I sure remember Tommy.  Mind if we talked about something else?

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: We don't have to talk at all.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Something tells me you've been here before.

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: Now what on earth would give you an idea like that?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: You're sure it's okay?

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: Don't worry. I'll respect you afterwards.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: What would you girls like to do? Want to stick around here for a little or... or could I suggest another plan...?

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: Like pick up some booze and go to a motel?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Or we could do that yeah.

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: Sid Worley, I think you're ashamed of me.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Ashamed? No -- I love you, Lynette. I mean that. After I leave them, I'll meet you at the motel, okay?

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: If you won't take me to dinner with your parents, I won't meet you at the motel.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Lynette, I told you already, it won't work.

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: Then, I'll see you around.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: By the way, shouldn't you have had a period by now?

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: I'm a little late, that's all.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: How late?

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: What difference does it make? If anything was to happen, which I'm sure it isn't, it would be my responsibility.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Exactly how late are you, Lynette?

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: What do you care? Suppose I was pregnant. Just suppose it. You don't think I'd try to make you do anything you don't want to, do you?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: No. But that's not the only issue here, sweetheart. There's a lot more to it than that.

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: What other issue is there, Sid?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: My responsibility as its father, for one. I mean, if I've made you pregnant, I'd want to... do the right thing.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: ...I'd want to pay for the abortion... I'd want to be with you through the whole thing... by your side.  So how late are you, Lynette?

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: Let's just wait and see what happens.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Hi, babe. Come on. I've got a couple of things I want to tell you.

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: What're you doing out of uniform, Sid? You don't want to get in trouble.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Forget that. Come on. Got a little surprise...

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: I can't go like this. Can't you wait a few minutes 'til I'm ready?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: No way. I'm so happy I'm about to bust. Here, honey. This is for you. It cost me my whole savings, but I said what the fuck.

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: Sid! Oh, it's beautiful! You mean...

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: That's right. Let's get married, Lynette. Let's find a justice of the peace and just do it!

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: Let's go tell Paula! God, I wonder where we'll be stationed first. I hope it'll be Hawaii. I've always wanted to go to Hawaii.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: We're not gonna be stationed anywhere, baby. I DORed.

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: You what?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: I had to, baby... I'm no aviator. I was faking it, like I was with everything else in my life... up 'til right now.

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: But... but what would we do? Where would we go?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Oklahoma. I can get my old job back at JC Penney's. In a couple of years, I'll be floor manager. Oh, you're gonna love Oklahoma, Lynette. You and mama'll get along just great. Of course, money will be a little tight for a while, but we'll make it.

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: Sid, there's no baby.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: I'm not pregnant. I got my period this morning. There's no baby, Sid.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Well, I'll be goddamned.

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: Come on, guys. It's five o'clock.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: One more minute.

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: Far fucking out! I've been wanting to meet one of the Blue Angels since I can remember.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Lynette, watch your mouth! Somebody might overhear.

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: Paula, look at the new Poopies.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Yeah, I saw 'em. Poor guys.

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: See you in a month when you get liberty!

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Don't worry. It grows out about an inch by them.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: That was you guys, huh?

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: Come on. Let's go dance.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Hurry, Lynette. It's almost midnight.

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: I got my foot on the floor.

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: Well, it you're not gonna ask, then I will. How was it?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Great.

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: Details, Pokrif. From what I saw he had an incredible body.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Yeah... Mmmm...

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: What did he do? Did he do anything that was different?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Everything was different.

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: But in what ways?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: How did it go with you guys?

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: Big Sid came in about two and a half seconds, then had the nerve to ask, 'Did you make it, too, sweetheart?'

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: He ask you out for next weekend?

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: No, but I told him I'd be at the Town Tavern next Saturday night, and he sounded like he might come.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: I told Zack about Saturday night, too. The fifth week's supposed to be the roughest. Come Wednesday, he'll be wishing he took my number.

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: You hope.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: He'll show. I'd bet my paycheck on it.

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: You serious about having him over?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: I haven't made up my mind.

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: Paula, how far would you go to catch Zack?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: You know what I mean. Would you... let yourself get pregnant?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: No way... Would you?

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: I never used to think I'd do something like that, but now I'm not so sure. You ask me, nine weeks just ain't long enough to get a guy to fall in love with you.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: That don't justify trying to trap a boy by getting pregnant, Lynette! Nothing justifies that. I can't believe you're even thinking like that. I mean, that's really backward.

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: No more backward, if you ask me, than the way these hotshot assholes fuck us, then ditch us.  Don't you ever feel used, Paula? Don't you ever feel like if this is all you get for your trouble then the sonofabitch ought to be paying for it...?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: No. I never feel like that.

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: I do.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Lynette, where's Sid?

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: Already come and gone. Can you believe it? He DORed in the twelfth week. How can you win?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: God help you, Lynette!

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: You're no better than me, Paula! You're just the same!

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: No! That's not true!
